snippet: While President Obama bolstered some protections for citizens, he did nothing, at least yet, to address the data security concerns of U.S. technology companies.
abstract: Pres Obama, pledging to limit government's access to phone records, says nothing to address data security concerns of American technology companies; does nothing yet to loosen National Security Agency's grip on world's digital pipelines; leaders of industry say it has lost billions in revenue due to perception by foreign consumers that American-made software is vulnerable to government spying.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Claire Cain Miller from San Francisco. Quentin Hardy contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: While President Obama bolstered some protections for citizens, he did nothing, at least yet, to address the data security concerns of U.S. technology companies.

headline.main: In Keeping Grip on Data Pipeline, Obama Does Little to Reassure Industry
headline.print_headline: Keeping U.S. Grip on Data Pipeline
